title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #1041** asks about paths in polynomial sublevel sets. For a monic polynomial f with all roots in the unit disk, the sublevel set {z : |f(z)| < 1} always contains all roots.

The **OPEN** conjecture asks: must there exist a path of length less than 2 connecting two roots within this sublevel set?

The 1958 Erdős-Herzog-Piranian paper proved the weaker result that such a set has a connected component with at least two roots.
mathContext: The constant 2 is sharp—it's the diameter of the unit disk. Roots could be nearly 2 apart.

title: Imports and Setup
content: We import Mathlib and open namespaces for **Polynomial** (complex polynomials), **MeasureTheory** (Hausdorff measure for path length), **ENNReal** (extended non-negative reals), **Metric** (distance and diameter), and **Topology** (continuous paths).

title: Sublevel Set Definition
content:
**sublevelSet f r** is the set of complex numbers where the polynomial has small absolute value:

`{z ∈ ℂ : ‖f.eval z‖ < r}`

For r = 1, this is the region where |f(z)| < 1. This set always contains all roots of f (since f(root) = 0 < 1).
mathContext: The sublevel set is open because polynomial evaluation and norm are continuous.

title: Path Length via Hausdorff Measure
content:
**length s** is defined as the 1-dimensional Hausdorff measure `μH[1] s`.

This generalizes arc length to arbitrary sets. For a rectifiable curve, it gives the usual notion of length. For fractal curves, it may be infinite.
mathContext: The 1-dimensional Hausdorff measure is the natural way to measure 'length' of potentially irregular curves.

title: Erdős-Herzog-Piranian Component Lemma (1958)
content:
**Known Result**: For any monic polynomial f of degree ≥ 2 with roots in the unit disk, the sublevel set {z : |f(z)| < 1} has a connected component containing at least two roots.

This was proved in the 1958 paper 'Metric properties of polynomials.' The proof uses potential theory—specifically, properties of the logarithmic potential associated with the polynomial's roots.
mathContext: Connected components partition the sublevel set. At least one component must be 'rich' enough to contain multiple roots.

title: Main Conjecture (OPEN)
content:
**Erdős Problem #1041**: Under the same hypotheses, there exists a **path** of length less than 2 within the sublevel set connecting two roots.

This strengthens the Component Lemma from mere connectivity to a quantitative bound. While the Component Lemma says roots are connected, a winding path could be arbitrarily long. This conjecture demands a SHORT path.
mathContext: The path γ : [0,1] → ℂ must satisfy: γ(0), γ(1) are distinct roots, the image lies in the sublevel set, and μH[1](range γ) < 2.

title: Diameter Bound
content:
The diameter of the root set is less than 2. Since all roots lie in the open unit disk and the unit disk has diameter 2, no two roots can be 2 or more apart.

This gives hope that a short path exists—we just need to find one in the sublevel set.

title: Quadratic Case (Base Case)
content:
For **degree 2** polynomials f(z) = (z - z₁)(z - z₂), the conjecture holds.

The straight line segment from z₁ to z₂ has length |z₁ - z₂| < 2, and one can show this segment lies entirely in the sublevel set.

This provides the base case for potential inductive approaches.
mathContext: For quadratics, the sublevel set {|f(z)| < 1} is the interior of a Cassini oval.

title: Sublevel Sets are Open
content:
**sublevelSet_isOpen**: The sublevel set {z : |f(z)| < r} is an open subset of ℂ.

Proof: Polynomial evaluation `f.eval` is continuous, norm is continuous, and the preimage of (-∞, r) under a continuous function is open.
mathContext: This uses the continuity of aeval (algebra evaluation) which generalizes polynomial evaluation.

title: Roots are in the Sublevel Set
content:
**roots_in_sublevelSet**: If z is a root of f, then z ∈ sublevelSet f 1.

Proof: f(z) = 0 implies |f(z)| = 0 < 1.

**roots_subset_sublevelSet**: All roots are contained in the sublevel set.
mathContext: This is the fundamental reason the problem makes sense—we're looking for paths in a set that contains the endpoints.

title: Distance Bound in Unit Disk
content:
**dist_in_unit_disk**: If |z₁| < 1 and |z₂| < 1, then |z₁ - z₂| < 2.

Proof by triangle inequality:
`|z₁ - z₂| ≤ |z₁| + |z₂| < 1 + 1 = 2`

This is why 2 is the critical constant in the conjecture.

title: Polynomial Lemniscates
content:
**lemniscate f c** is the level set {z : |f(z)| = c}.

These curves are called polynomial lemniscates, generalizing the classical Bernoulli lemniscate (for f(z) = z² - 1). They have rich geometric properties studied since the 18th century.
mathContext: The sublevel set is the interior bounded by the lemniscate at level 1.

title: Unit Disk Diameter
content:
**unit_disk_diameter_bound**: The diameter of the open unit disk ball(0, 1) is at most 2.

This uses the general formula diam(ball(x, r)) ≤ 2r. For the unit disk (r = 1), this gives diameter ≤ 2.

The bound 2 in the conjecture is thus geometrically sharp.
